Reviews.Title: “Great value with AARON discount!”
Reviews.Author: scorpette
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfy beds and nice pool. Also enjoyed free breakfast. Good food all around this location. Texas Roadhouse right out the back door. Love this one!

Reviews.Title: “Rippled bed and toe nails”
Reviews.Author: dan g
Reviews.Content: Found toe nails under the ottoman and the tub wall and knobs had long black hair on them. Room smelled when I turned on the heater. The bed wasnt worthy of a dogs stay. I have been a Hampton loyal customer for years and will now start entertaining Holiday Inn Express for a better nights sleep. Was very disappointed when the girl at the front desk ignored me when I told her the bed was killing my back. It actually had slat board ripples in it. Hell Ive sleep on the ground deer hunting and didnt wake up this miserable. I refuse to stay here again as their just are to many other choices. I left early after being ignored and slept in the car at a highway restop. So much for their guarentees. Im really upset.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn - Indianapolis South”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily714612
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed by the poor quality of housekeeping. The bed linens were dingy and the bathroom floor and toilet were sticky with urine. There was a dirty towel hanging behind the door.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Indianapolis South”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne_and_co
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with typical amenities. Our room smelled like incense but other than that, very nice. Good breakfast and right off I65. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “What you need to know”
Reviews.Author: business-traveler-Mn
Reviews.Content: There more a this location, Two fast food restraurants, two Chain sitdown restraurants, and a pub. Plus a gas station, If you are a roadwarrior, this is not a bad location to stop. The hotel is well run, the rooms are clean and quiet, the TV has 60+ channels, plus lodgnet, for pay per view movies. The breakfast area is large so there will not be a problem finding a place to sit to enjoy breakfast. The driveway into the parking lot is a little steep, so if you are towing something you will drag the bumper. All of the parking is in the front of the building, there is parking behind, but it belongs to a chain restraurant.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Hampton, Convenient, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: stl82
Reviews.Content: This Hampton in very conveniently located just off I-65, with several places to eat within walking distance, and just a short drive to many other shops and restaurants. The hotel appears to be an older Hampton but was very clean and well maintained. Our room, with a king bed and sofa bed, was smaller than similar accommodations at other Hampton Inns. The desk and closet were built-in along the outside wall and the sofa bed was against the inside wall. This made a very tight arrangement. When someone was sitting at the desk it was not possible to move between the desk chair and the bed to get to the closet. Even when the chair was empty it was a tight squeeze. The furnishing were all in good condition as was the room. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. There were a large number of channels on the TV and internet connection was easy to hook up and was fast. The breakfast selection was pretty standard but well prepared and tasty for this type of buffet. The buffet and eating areas were clean and neat. The fitness room had a couple of treadmills, an elliptical and stationery bike, please free weights. All very well maintained. The highpoint of the hotel was the staff. The person who checked us in, Tyler, was excellent. Took care of getting us checked in with no fuss. I needed to send a fax and he tried several times but it would not go through. Since he was able to receive and send other faxes that day with no problem the issue must have been some kind incompatibility between the sending and receiving machines. But he did his best to make it work even while dealing with other check-ins and guests with questions, etc. He is a real valuable asset to this hotel. The person who took care of the buffet (I didn't get her name) was also very friendly and helpful She kept the buffet stocked and clean. The desk person on the morning we checked out was also very friendly. All in all, the staff was great. The only complaint I have is that the bath tub in our room is set about 1-2" above the floor, This is not problem when getting into the tub, but if you are not aware of it when stepping out it is easy to lose your balance, as I did. I was able to regain my balance without falling but I did bang my shin against the tub. I don't know if this is standard layout in all of the rooms but I think it is a real safety hazard. I agree with others who commented that the rate is a bit high. I think it is on the high end for what you get but this is in a metropolitan area. If we are in this area again, this Hampton would be considered but I would also look at other options that perhaps offer a bit more for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jen K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by management at nearby restaurant. Inviting lobby, extremely courteous staff, clean comfortable rooms and bed, did not use pool or fitness room. Breakfast was not bad - nice selection of options including make-your-own waffles! Coffee in the rooms was better than the lobby coffee. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hampton Experience”
Reviews.Author: iamzeke
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was excellent but hotel needs an update and overhaul...very "tired" looking. Excellent breakfast by Hampton standards...beds very comfortable. Front desk staff very accommodating and helpful. Over-priced ($109 before tax) compared to other hotels in area. Also Hampton program charging 25,000 points for free room outrageous compared to 7,500 points for comparable Fairfield...3X's the points....really? Not worth it so that's why I'm burning up my Hampton points and will concentrate on staying in Marriott properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: Traveler36015
Reviews.Content: This was your typical hampton inn with a staff that is not as friendly I as usually find. I travel for business 24 weeks a year, and I usually find the staff at most Hamptons friendly and happy. The staff here was just not happy or friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location/Colts game”
Reviews.Author: 62mike
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled from Nashville to the Colts/Bengals game and stayed at this location the night before. The room was as nice as any Hilton we have stayed in. The breakfast which was free was very nice but comparable with other chains complimentary breakfasts. The location is great. Every chain restaurant you would want is within a mile of the hotel and there are 3-4 right out the front door of the hotel within walking distance. It is right off the interstate and a less than 10 minute drive to Lucas Oil Stadium. Lots of shopping close by as well. Good wi-fi my daughter enjoyed it the whole evening.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TZC2
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family and was happy to find a nicely decorated room with a microwave and refridg. It was also close to a Meijer grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Typical, very nice (and clean) Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: bbmss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Indianapolis-South (7045 McFarland Blvd) most recently on a Tuesday night. I had stayed here previously a few years ago. Typical, very nice (and clean) Hampton Inn. The hotel shares a site and parking lot with several restaurants: Texas Roadhouse, Bon Evans, Wendy’s, and Stake-and-Shake. Within a one mile drive, there are numerous other hotels, restaurants, and shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ejonone
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hampton just south of the I465 bypass at the Southport Rd. exit. Nice, quiet motel. Double beds in our room were comfy. Quiet, residential area nearby for a walk or a run. A nice stop on our way south to drop our son off at college.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hampton Inn with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelersChicago
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Hampton's on serveral occassions across the country. This Hampton was by far the best we've stayed at. Easy access from the highway. The hotel has been recently updated. The rooms were clean. The employees were helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Interstate Traveler's Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Lifelister
Reviews.Content: Chic decor, all new, spotless. Good wi-fi in room. Super comfy bed and pillows. All utilities work well. Microwave and fridge in room. Only suggested improvement: bathroom lighting was a little dim in my room. Water was off for two hours mid-day for some plumbing service. Warning was posted. Breakfast bar was loaded with fresh healthy stuff to sticky, yummy fattening stuff. I liked the long window of 6 to 10 a.m. Location is south of downtown, just off I65. I paid around $90.

Reviews.Title: “You always know you will have a great experience at Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: IndianaOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I stayed at this Hampton Inn for a college graduation. They have newly renovated which made the price a little higher than it had been during a previous visit, but the experience, quality, breakfast, cleanliness, etc made it worth it! With Hampton Inn, you always know you are going to have a great experience. I always look for Hampton Inn anywhere I travel because they are consistently excellent. Indianapolis Hampton Inn South is conveniently located near Southport Road and has Texas Roadhouse, Bob Evans, Steak & Shake, Carraba's, and Cheeseburger in Paradise within walking distance. It also has KFC, Uno's, Qdoba, Starbucks and much more within close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: heatherinPhilly
Reviews.Content: I spend over 100 nights a year in a hotel, most of them in the Hilton family. This property is BY FAR the best Hampton I have ever stayed at. They just finished a massive renovation - basically gutted every guest room and replaced everything. New carpets, tiles/granite in the bathroom, furniture etc. Everything is spotless. The only thing that they are still working on is the fitness center, which is scheduled to be completed next week. In the meantime, all guests can use a health club down the street. Staff was great - very friendly. I had a nice chat with the Assistant GM about the renovations. I also used the business center (which I never do) to print a rather long document, and they had a new HP laser printer that printed very fast. Breakfast was standard Hampton fare - but seemed to be replenished a bit more often than at most other Hamptons I have been at. Location is convenient to Indy, I65, and there are tons of restaurants nearby. If my business ever brings me to Indy again, I will definitely be staying at this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Indianapolis South
HotelInfo.Address: 7045 McFarland Blvd, Indianapolis, IN 46237
